titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T19:31-0400

did.abstract: There is much correspondence, as well as reports, notebooks, lectures, diaries, photographs, and reprints. Heiser, who was a preeminent public health physician, created a rich archive of material documenting all phases of his career, especially the international health work of the Rockefeller Foundation from 1913-1934. There are voluminous, detailed, and interesting diaries for the whole course of this life (ca. 68 v., 1908-1972). There are notebooks reflecting on his early training and work (21 v., 1890-1907), and 3 volumes from lectures he attended at Jefferson Medical College in Philadelphia (grad., 1898).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift from George Victor Heiser and accessioned, 1966 (1966 952ms). Ca. 7500 items presented by Heiser estate and accessioned, 12/07/1972 (1972 2313ms); interviews and diaries presented by Heiser estate and accessioned, 1972 (1972 1062ms, 1062.ams).

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: Presented by Victor George Heiser and his estate, 1966-1972.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Victor George Heiser was a physician and was involved in international health work with the Rockefeller Foundation.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Only Series I, Correspondence, and Photographs are described below.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A selection of the photographs available in the Victor (Victor George) Heiser papers.

Native American Images note : 26 black and white silver gelatin photographs of Panama, Honduras, Guatemala, and El Salvador, primarily stelae with Mayan hieroglyphics, from 1927. Photographed by Heiser on a trip to Central America in his capacity as associate director of the International Health division of the Rockefeller Foundation. Details are contained in his diary of March 31, 1927 to June 27, 1927. The photographs are housed in the photograph collection, numbers U5.4.115-139, and U5.8.80.
